poem:
**Flop's Resilience**

In Dudley's care,  
a penguin named Flop,  
motherless, father roaming—  
earth's tremor beneath her—  
found flight in a bouncer's hug.  
Wet feathers stirred,  
gravity defied,  
as zookeepers swayed  
uncharted rhythms,  
she learned the waddle—  
her tiny feet reclaiming land,  
in that tender bounce,  
rebirth found its stance.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Baby bouncer’ helps pick up poorly penguin so she can learn to stand again A Humboldt penguin who lost her ability to waddle has learned to stand on her own feet again thanks to a unique idea from Dudley zookeepers – a specially designed baby bouncer. Flop hatched in April, and was reared by Dudley zoo’s bird care team after her mother died and her dad started leaving the nest for long periods of time.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Baby bouncer’ helps pick up poorly penguin so she can learn to stand again A Humboldt penguin who lost her ability to waddle has learned to stand on her own feet again thanks to a unique idea from Dudley zookeepers – a specially designed baby bouncer. Flop hatched in April, and was reared by Dudley zoo’s bird care team after her mother died and her dad started leaving the nest for long periods of time.
